list.name: Changes
list.comment: Refactored Seat and Ticket module in order to configure the frontend app in Angular properly (developing UI for working with tickets there)

task.summary: Default task
Implemented authorization (for now, without user ticket purchasing functionality)
Started ticket purchase functionality (with implemented authorization)
Managed concurrency when adding tickets into user's cart before committing purchase
Implemented committing purchase functionality + viewing purchased tickets
Tried to deploy (not fully successful yet)
Deployed with Docker (please, check README file in order to get info about admin credentials and check admin functionality when running the app)
Did some refactoring
Connected Hibernate. Started implementing Hibernate for User entity
Implemented Hibernate for User and Arena entities
Written tests for UserDao and ArenaDao
Added HikariCP connection pool + did some refactoring
Implemented Hibernate for SectorDao, added tests for SectorDao class + again some refactoring and java doc
Implemented Hibernate for SportEventDao
Started implementing Hibernate for remaining dao classes (for now, have some bugs and no unit-tests)
Continuing implementing Hibernate for remaining dao classes (fixed bugs, still no tests)
Started implementing language internationalization
Continuing implementing language internationalization (refactored all the .jsp files)
Finished implementing language internationalization
Added mappers, java doc (+ some refactoring in my jsp pages)
Moved some of the Hibernate db connection properties values into env vars
Started implementing Spring Boot (refactoring pom.xml, adding necessary starters, not completely successful yet)
Started moving from MVC to REST, added Swagger and Liquibase
Refactored ArenaController, SectorController, RowController, SportEventController (REST instead of MVC)
Refactored the rest of the controllers: UserCartController, UserController, TicketController, TicketsPurchaseController (REST instead of MVC)
Started implementing JWT into SpringSecurity
Implemented JWT into SpringSecurity (have role authorization, but for now - no refresh tokens)
Adding refresh token mechanism (not fully successfully tested yet)
Fixed and tested refresh token mechanism, refactored internalization (EN/RU), tested metrics within Actuator, added JavaDoc
Refactored unit-tests for service classes
Refactored unit-tests for controller layer
Wrote integration tests for repositories using Testcontainers (no unit-tests for repositories)
Merged spring-boot-develop branch, removed some of the redundant dependencies from pom.xml
Refactor: fixed docker containers (created container for spring boot app instead of pure tomcat container)
Added some info into README, excluded integration tests from build
Added some info into README for proper testing of my app locally
Added some info into README for proper testing of my app locally
Added some info into README for proper testing of my app locally
Refactored RowRepository and SectorRepository (found some problems while testing once again with Swagger)
Switched off some of the spring security settings for testing communication with the front-end Angular app
Refactored code after reading my code-review recommendations (added RestControllerAdvice to handle exceptions, occurred in the controller layer, globally)
Refactored code for proper testing of front-end (working with Angular)
Started managing services communication
Added proper Kafka configs, now communication with the second microservice is working
Fixed pagination and filtration for SportEvent entities
Did some refactoring, now finally able to get the images (and show them on the client-side) from the second microservice (ImageService)
Fixed the updating of the SportEvent entity (now with it's poster image)
Finished refactoring the SportEvent module as well as managing images functionality (except WebSocket yet), added some JavaDoc, refactored some of the tests
Updated README file
Refactored Seat and Ticket module in order to configure the frontend app in Angular properly (developing UI for working with tickets there)

MESSAGE.value: Refactored ArenaController, SectorController, RowController, SportEventController (REST instead of MVC)
Refactored the rest of the controllers: UserCartController, UserController, TicketController, TicketsPurchaseController (REST instead of MVC)
Started implementing JWT into SpringSecurity
Implemented JWT into SpringSecurity (have role authorization, but for now - no refresh tokens)
Adding refresh token mechanism (not fully successfully tested yet)
Fixed and tested refresh token mechanism, refactored internalization (EN/RU), tested metrics within Actuator, added JavaDoc
Refactored unit-tests for service classes
Refactored unit-tests for controller layer
Wrote integration tests for repositories using Testcontainers (no unit-tests for repositories)
Merged spring-boot-develop branch, removed some of the redundant dependencies from pom.xml
Refactor: fixed docker containers (created container for spring boot app instead of pure tomcat container)
Added some info into README, excluded integration tests from build
Added some info into README for proper testing of my app locally
Refactored RowRepository and SectorRepository (found some problems while testing once again with Swagger)
Switched off some of the spring security settings for testing communication with the front-end Angular app
Refactored code after reading my code-review recommendations (added RestControllerAdvice to handle exceptions, occurred in the controller layer, globally)
Refactored code for proper testing of front-end (working with Angular)
Started managing services communication
Added proper Kafka configs, now communication with the second microservice is working
Fixed pagination and filtration for SportEvent entities
Did some refactoring, now finally able to get the images (and show them on the client-side) from the second microservice (ImageService)
Fixed the updating of the SportEvent entity (now with it's poster image)
Finished refactoring the SportEvent module as well as managing images functionality (except WebSocket yet), added some JavaDoc, refactored some of the tests
Updated README file
Refactored Seat and Ticket module in order to configure the frontend app in Angular properly (developing UI for working with tickets there)
